questions.question_text: What are two requirements for the automated deployment of the vRealize Suite products using vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager? (Choose two.)

choices.A: An IP Pool must be created for each of the solutions.
choices.B: vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager must be deployed from SDDC Manager during the bring-up process.
choices.E: A connection to the "My VMware" Account must be set up in vRealize Lifecycle Manager.

comments.content:
B seems to be incorrect. 
The deployment of vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager is done manually. Deployments of vRealize
Log Insight, vRealize Network Insight, and vRealize Automation are automated through vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager

questions.question_text: What is a valid use case for using multiple clusters in a workload domain?

discussion.content: D, "some applications have licensing models to restrict the number of hosts that they can run on. By deploying a separate cluster for such applications, you can ensure licensing compliance while minimizing the license cost" - VMware Cloud Foundation: Planning , Management Operations page 183

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

choices.B: Resource pools are configured for separation of development and production workloads.
choices.C: Applications and database servers should not run on the same host.
choices.D: Applications are licensed per physical CPU.
choices.A: Four new hosts are racked and stacked.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
VMFS on Fibre Channel storage is not configure for networkpool type.
Since is not MGMT WLD, vSAN is not mandatory for VI WLD., answer is A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
Ref. https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.5/vcf-admin/GUID-BC60080F-FCBE-47F9-B696-72CAE2A41EAF.html
